original_definition: 'scheduled exchange' means an electricity transfer scheduled between geographic areas, for each market time unit and for a given direction;
generated_definition: 'scheduled exchange' means calculation of scheduled exchanges based on net positions as specified in article 52(1)(b) using a common methodology developed by tsos for single intraday coupling, to be implemented by 16 months after the entry into force of this regulation.

Article 2: ‘scheduled exchange’ means an electricity transfer scheduled between geographic areas, for each market time unit and for a given direction;
‘scheduled exchange’ means an electricity transfer scheduled between geographic areas, for eachmarket time unit and for a given direction;
Article 9: the common methodologies for the calculation of scheduled exchanges in accordance with Articles 43(1) and 56(1);
Article 43: Methodology for calculating scheduled exchanges resulting from single day-ahead coupling

4.   No later than two years after the approval by the regulatory authorities of the concerned region of the proposal referred to in paragraph 1, TSOs applying scheduled exchanges shall review the methodology. Thereafter, if requested by the competent regulatory authorities, the methodology shall be reviewed every two years.

1.   By 16 months after the entry into force of this Regulation, TSOs which intend to calculate scheduled exchanges resulting from single day-ahead coupling shall develop a proposal for a common methodology for this calculation. The proposal shall be subject to consultation in accordance with Article 12.
